intro: Andersonia micrantha, commonly known as the dwarf orchid or the mountain orchid, is a species of flowering plant in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to the southern regions of Australia, particularly in the states of New South Wales and Victoria. This plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale green, and it grows in rocky or sandy soils. Andersonia micrantha is a terrestrial orchid that thrives in cool, shaded environments, often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
